column11: Dividing into two triangles: Triangle 1: (0,0), (4,0), (4,3). Area = 1/2 |0(0-3) + 4(3-0) + 4(0-0)| = 6. Triangle 2: (0,0), (4,3), (0,3). Area = 1/2 |0(3-3) + 4(3-0) + 0(0-3)| = 6. Total = 12 square units. Answer: 12 square units

Find the point on y-axis which is equidistant from (3
Option_C: Let the point be (0, y). Distance from (3, 4): √[(0-3)² + (y-4)²] = √[9 + (y-4)²]. Distance from (-3, 4): √[(0+3)² + (y-4)²] = √[9 + (y-4)²]. Both are equal for all y. But since both points have y=4, the point on y-axis equidistant is (0, 4). Answer: (0, 4)

column12: In a parallelogram, diagonals bisect each other. Midpoint of AC = Midpoint of BD. Midpoint of AC = ((1+x)/2, (2+6)/2) = ((1+x)/2, 4). Midpoint of BD = ((4+3)/2, (y+5)/2) = (7/2, (y+5)/2). Equating: (1+x)/2 = 7/2, x = 6. (y+5)/2 = 4, y = 3. Answer: x = 6, y = 3

column9: Area = 1/2 |a((c+a) - (a+b)) + b((a+b) - (b+c)) + c((b+c) - (c+a))| = 1/2 |a(c-b) + b(a-c) + c(b-a)| = 1/2 |ac - ab + ab - bc + bc - ac| = 1/2 × 0 = 0. Answer: 0 square units (points are collinear)
